title: Wang Yingfan_Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China

quotes: Wang Yingfan (1942.4-) Vice Minister, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, People's Republic of China (1995.8-)
Wang Yingfan (1942.4-) Vice Minister, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, People's Republic of China (1995.8-)
Born in Tuquan, Inner Mongolia, Wang Yingfan graduated from the English Department of Beijing Foreign Languages Institute in November 1964.
After 1980, he served as Deputy Director, Director, and Deputy Director General (1985.5-1988.7) of the Department of Asian Affairs, Ambassador to the Philippines (1988.7-1990.10),
After 1980, he served as Deputy Director, Director, and Deputy Director General (1985.5-1988.7) of the Department of Asian Affairs, Ambassador to the Philippines (1988.7-1990.10),
Director General of the Department of Asian Affairs of Ministry of Foreign Affairs (1990.11-1994.1), and Assistant Foreign Minister (1994.1-1995.8).
Director General of the Department of Asian Affairs of Ministry of Foreign Affairs (1990.11-1994.1), and Assistant Foreign Minister (1994.1-1995.8).

From September 1995 to February 1996, he attended the Senior Officials Meetings of Asian members and all the members of the First Asia Europe Meeting respectively held in Spain and Thailand for preparing the meeting.
